DOC.brief_title: Support Person Intervention Promote Smoking Helpline Among Under Resourced Smokers
DOC.detailed_description: This proposal conduct pilot study adapt effective 1 session phone coach intervention nonsmoking support person low income population . The study also pilot new intervention component include text messaging health incentive . The goal intervention support person prompt smoker use quitline service . The study also build prior work enrol smoker assessment quit attempt smoke abstinence . The study use non-randomized , single group design . Thirty nonsmoker-smoker dyad enrol three wave 10 . The nonsmoker receive different intervention component depend time enrollment . Nonsmokers complete assessment baseline 1 month follow-up . Smokers enrol assessment baseline 3 month follow-up . The vendor Minnesota state quitline , Alere Wellbeing Inc. ( sole subsidiary Optum ) track smoker use quitline service 3 month follow-up . The aim pilot study : ( 1 ) Assess feasibility enrol low income , racially diverse nonsmoker-smoker dyad ; ( 2 ) Adapt refine support person intervention component low income population feedback nonsmoker participant ; ( 3 ) Assess feasibility obtain assessment smoker quit attempt smoke abstinence outcome . The preliminary finding use provide data R01 NIH grant submission .
